info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 04 at 12:39AM EDT until May 04 at 1:15AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN FAUQUIER COUNTY... At 1238 AM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northeast of Bealeton, or 7 miles southeast of Warrenton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Bealeton, Opal, Catlett, Calverton, Midland and Casanova. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
